info.title: API Banking - Securities Services APIs
info.description:
The Standard Chartered API Banking Channel offers entities the capability of connecting to the Bank’s services through a message based, robust, real time set of APIs. The APIs offer a 24/7, highly available & secure service that can be directly connected to an entity’s internal systems.
The offering complements our existing channels through an industry standardised interface and addressing some of the limitations of batch oriented file based, scheduled delivery mechanisms.

The Channels three key features:
**INDUSTRY STANDARD SECURITY**
message level security (MLS) using RSA private/public keys & transport security through https client certificates
**PUSH NOTIFICATIONS**
real-time push notification of events through our guaranteed webhook delivery mechanism
**REST SERVICES**
rich set of APIs to expose data via a suite of json based rest APIs following industry schemas such as UPI and OPENAPI.

tags.name: Custody Services
tags.description: Custody Services APIs provides information about custody holdings, transactions and valuations. Custodian Services APIs allow to perform securities portfolio checks at customer convenience within agreed parameters. It also enables real time market information readily and swiftly available to end users.

tags.name: Funds and Fiduciary Services
tags.description: Funds and Fiduciary Services APIs provides information about custody holdings, transactions and valuations. Securities Services APIs allow to perform securities portfolio checks and processing at customer convenience within agreed parameters.

tags.name: Corporate Actions
tags.description: Corporate Actions APIs provide information about Corporate Action (CA) Events Notifications. It allows to search for CA Events, retrieve its details, as well as retrieve eligible trades, positions and entitlement details for Corporate Action Events.

tags.name: Common Services
tags.description: This Service is used to get the List of billing details according to the Input provided by the user. User also has provision to get records based on Optional attributes given below.

get.description: The Fund Transactions API is used to retrieve the transaction details recorded against a specific fund within a specific range of dates.

parameters.name: fundCode
parameters.description: Fund Code to retrieve fund Transactions

parameters.name: navFromDate
parameters.description: Nav From Date to retrieve fund Positions

parameters.name: navToDate
parameters.description: Nav To Date to retrieve fund Positions

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

429.description: Default return code for health status, indicating a warning

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates an error in the API server

503.description: System dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

get.description: The Fund Positions API is used to deliver the holdings of the specified fund on a specific day. A portfolio position API depicts the holding positions of a fund, it will return the details of all investments in a fund such as Equities, Bonds, Futures, Options, Swaps, Deposits, FX transactions etc.This will allow the recipients users to get the retrieve the cost and market values of the investments in the Fund currency and security currency with Unrealized gains/losses for each positions which will facilitate informed investment decisions.

parameters.name: fundCode
parameters.description: Fund Code to retrieve fund Positions

parameters.name: navDate
parameters.description: Nav Date to retrieve fund Positions

application/json.example:
{
    "header": {
        "timestamp": "2020-01-28T09:01:58.369Z",
        "status": "Complete",
        "id": "77e6818a-0896-4cb3-8822-664b08fa9e1e"
    },
    "fundPositions": [
        {
            "fundName": "MANAGED FUND",
            "fundCode": "SG01",
            "fundCurrency": "SGD",
            "navValueDate": "2017-11-09",
            "securityName": "LB BADEN-WUERTTEMBERG 3.75% 18/05/2027",
            "securityCurrency": "SGD",
            "fundCountry": "",
            "isinSecurityCode": "DE000LB1DUU1",
            "bloombergSecurityCode": "AN4032602",
            "assetClassDesc": "202 - Investment - Corporate Bonds / Debentures",

}

get.description: The Retrieve Fund NAV API allows to retrieve the Net Asset Value (NAV) of the fund for a specific day for a specific fund. This API will provide the NAV related details such as the NAV currency, NAV amount, NAV/Unit, the Outstanding shares as on the NAV date. Once the client provides the fund ID (external/SC fund ID) and the required date, the API will retrieve the latest NAV information for that date and send to the requester. If the requested date NAV data is not available at the time, it should provide latest available NAV data with correct date.

parameters.name: fundCode
parameters.description: ID which will retrieve Fund Nav Result

parameters.name: navDate
parameters.description: Date which will retrieve Fund positions

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

429.description: Default return code for health status, indicating a warning

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates an error in the API server

503.description: System dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

get.description: The Fund Top Holdings API is used to deliver the Top ‘N’ holdings of the specified fund on a specific day. A portfolio position API depicts the holding positions of a fund, it will return the details of all investments in a fund such as Equities, Bonds, Futures, Options, Swaps, Deposits, FX transactions etc.This will allow the recipients users to get the retrieve the cost and market values of the investments in the Fund currency and security currency with Unrealized gains/losses for each positions which will facilitate informed investment decisions.

parameters.name: fundCode
parameters.description: Fund Code to retrieve fund Top Holdings

parameters.name: navDate
parameters.description: Nav Date to retrieve fund Positions

parameters.name: topNCount
parameters.description: Top number of result to retrieve fund holdings

application/json.example:
{
    "header": {
        "timestamp": "2020-01-28T08:48:48.895Z",

get.description: The Securities Services Market News API is an additional channel for clients to receive newsflashes near real time, bringing tailored information quicker to their end user(s),whilst introducing efficiencies by eliminating manual collation and distribution by emails.  The customisable newsflashes are published in JSON format to clients based on their subscription and interest maintained in the API layer and can be directly integrated into their infrastructure, allowing the client to maintain internal checker processes and underlying user subscriptions in a timely manner.

parameters.name: newsflashId
parameters.description: Newsflash ID to retrieve market news

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

401.description: Access token has expired. Please refresh the token

429.description: Default return code for health status, indicating a warning

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates error on the webserver hosting the API

503.description: Microservice dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

get.description: The Securities Services - Market News Attachment API provides an ability to download newsflash attachment based on the attachment ID.

parameters.name: newsflashId
parameters.description: Newsflash ID which is used to retrieve market news

parameters.name: attachmentId
parameters.description: Attachment ID which is used to retrieve market news attachment

application/json.example:

post.description: Custody Client Holdings API provides the capability to clients to subscribe and retrieve their custody holdings & positions anytime. Currently similar information is provided to clients only through end of day batch processing via SWIFT messages. \nThis API follows the Circuit breaker pattern where Client request is acknowledged back with the unique reference number instantaneously and Standard Chartered Bank will post the response back to clients via web hook once the API response are prepared.

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

429.description: Default return code for health status, indicating a warning

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates an error in the API server

503.description: System dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

get.description: Clients can use this API to retrieve their Custody Portfolio request status, by providing the unique reference number returned by Standard Chartered Bank for the Securities Services Portfolio request.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID which will retrieve security positions

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

429.description: Default return code for health status, indicating a warning

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates an error in the API server

503.description: System dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

post.description:
Within the lifecycle of a Settlement Transaction there are a series of statuses that help to track the stage of the instruction. These statuses are important due to the number of entities the transaction passes; Custodians, Sub-custodians, Depositories and other Intermediaries to get visibility of securities and payment movement.

From each stage within the lifecycle a SWIFT status update message is sent back to clients. In recent trends, the availability of transaction status is not just required for processing, instead more and more clients are asking for a statistical view to perform and visualise analytical view.

The Securities Services Settlement Transaction Status API offering provides the capability for clients to subscribe to the transaction status near real time, allowing them to make actionable decisions more quickly.

The API comprises of key parameters as input and flexibly retrieves the essential status listed below.

Authorised - Client Settlement transaction instruction has been received by SCB, verified and successfully validated.

Matched - Client Settlement transactions has been communicated to the Central Depository and Matched successfully with the counterparty.

Partially Matched - Client Settlement transactions has been communicated to the Central Depository. Holdings are Partially matched successfully with the counterparty.

Partially Settled - Client Settlement transactions Partially Settled successfully with the counterparty.

Stock Settled - Client Settlement transactions successfully Stock settled in Standard Chartered Bank's trade processing system. Securities movements between beneficiaries (processing and recording share movement) has been completed in the central depository system.

Cash Settled - Client Settlement transactions successfully Cash settled in SCB's trade processing system. Funds (Cash) payments, processing and recording has been completed in the central depository system.

Cancelled - Client Settlement transactions previously instructed but later cancelled by the client.

Failed - Client Settlement transactions which are failed during settlement process.

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

429.description: Default return code for health status, indicating a warning

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates an error in the API server

503.description: System dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

post.description: The Securities Services Settlement Transaction Initiation API provides the ability for the clients to initiate the settlement transaction. Standard Chartered Financing & Securities Services offers a new added advantage and an option for clients to adopt alternate channel via API and embrace Open banking APIs transformation besides SWIFT messaging. With this industry leading solution, Standard Chartered clients can utilise the overall suite of Custody API offerings over the entire lifecycle of Settlement processing - initiate settlement transaction, receive the transaction status and also request for their positions at any time with all the APIs which are available in Standard Chartered API store.

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

409.description: Resource already exists. Cannot create a new one

429.description: Default return code for health status, indicating a warning

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates an error in the API server

503.description: System dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

post.description:
Standard Chartered Bank as Global Custodian provides a comprehensive corporate actions services covering the entire lifecycle of the event which includes Event capture, Eligibility and entitlement calculation, Voluntary corporate action processing, Corporate action proceeds collection and disbursement. Our sophisticated enterprise data management platform (Golden Source) and global corporate action platform (SeCCure) processes event data from various sources like Exchanges, Depository, Recognised Data Vendors etc. to ensure comprehensive data coverage. Data received from multiple sources are scrubbed internally and gold copy is produced for reporting of corporate action event information to clients. Though information is reported to clients through various e-channels currently, as our endeavour to improve reporting standards, we are glad to introduce Corporate Action APIs services. This would open new avenue for the clients for sourcing corporate actions details.
The Event Search API is used to retrieve basic information on forthcoming voluntary or mandatory event information. This can be used to track announcements in the market irrespective of holdings the stock. The following parameters can be used for retrieval- BP ID, SCA ID, Event ID, Event Type, Event Group, Event Classification, Event Key Dates range (i.e. Announcement Date Exchange Date, Record Date, Meeting Date, etc.)

application/json.example:
{
  "caEventSearchRes": [
  {
    "corporateRef": "2100056881002",
    "officialCorporateRef": "US124214426",
    "eventType": "TNDP",
    "eventTypeDesc": "Tax On Non-Distributed Proceeds",
    "eventGroup": "MANDREOG",
    "eventGroupDesc": "Mandatory Reorgs",
    "eventClassification": "MAND",
    "eventClassificationDesc": "Mandatory",
    "status": "Authorized",
    "marketEvent": "US",
    "custodianName": "BBH, NY",
    "securityId": "10470578",
    "securityShortName": "BARCLAYS BANK PLC - IPATH SHILLER C",
    "preferredNumScheme": "Golden Source Identifier",
    "securityType": "Structured Instrument",
    "announcementDate": "20201210",
    "recordDate": "20200224",
    "meetTime": ""
  }
  ],
  "caApiPageInfo": {
    "pageNumber": 1,
    "numberOfRecords": 1
  }
}

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates an error in the API server

503.description: System dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

post.description: Standard Chartered Bank as Global Custodian provides a comprehensive corporate actions services covering the entire lifecycle of the event which includes Event capture, Eligibility and entitlement calculation, Voluntary corporate action processing, Corporate action proceeds collection and disbursement. Our sophisticated enterprise data management platform (Golden Source) and global corporate action platform (SeCCure) processes event data from various sources like Exchanges, Depository, Recognised Data Vendors etc. to ensure comprehensive data coverage. Data received from multiple sources are scrubbed internally and gold copy is produced for reporting of corporate action event information to clients. Though information is reported to clients through various e-channels currently, as our endeavour to improve reporting standards, we are glad to introduce Corporate Action APIs services. This would open new avenue for the clients for sourcing corporate actions details. The Event Details API is an extension of Corporate Action Event Search API which includes additional information on underlying event options and pay-outs based on holding positions. This can be used by the client for tracking forthcoming voluntary events which requires election from the clients. The following parameters can be used for retrieval- BP ID, SCA ID, Event ID, Event Key Dates range (i.e. Record Date, Response Deadline Date etc).

application/json.example:
{
    "caEventDetailsRes": [
    {
            "corporateRef": "2100012931002",
            "officialCorporateRef": "",

        "pageNumber": 1
    }
}

post.description: Standard Chartered Bank as Global Custodian provides a comprehensive corporate actions services covering the entire lifecycle of the event which includes Event capture, Eligibility and entitlement calculation, Voluntary corporate action processing, Corporate action proceeds collection and disbursement. Our sophisticated enterprise data management platform (Golden Source) and global corporate action platform (SeCCure) processes event data from various sources like Exchanges, Depository, Recognised Data Vendors etc. to ensure comprehensive data coverage. Data received from multiple sources are scrubbed internally and gold copy is produced for reporting of corporate action event information to clients. Though information is reported to clients through various e-channels currently, as our endeavour to improve reporting standards, we are glad to introduce Corporate Action APIs services. This would open new avenue for the clients for sourcing corporate actions details. The Eligibility and Entitlements Details API facilitates fetching events eligible position, cash and security entitlement information and its payment date. Expected inflow / outflow information can help in planning future investments. 400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates an error in the API server

503.description: System dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

post.description: The Billing API provides clients an additional channel in receiving billing invoices and details via API, bringing more streamlined billing capability and swift data delivery as compared to receiving the invoices in file format like PDF, Excel or Word via emails.

400.description: Invalid request. Missing or invalid data

409.description: Resource already exists. Cannot create a new one

429.description: Default return code for health status, indicating a warning

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates an error in the API server

503.description: System dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

post.summary: Custody FX Approval - Proof of Underlying
post.description: In regulated markets, prevailing foreign exchange (FX) regulations requires proof of underlying (POU) of economic activity before a non-resident investor can execute FX transactions, the Securities Services Custody FX Approval API automates the approval process of POU powered with intelligent rules engine that can be customised at market level this reduces a potentially multi-hour manual process to less than one minute turn-around time

409.description: Resource already exists. Cannot create a new one

429.description: Default return code for health status, indicating a warning

500.description: Internal server error. This indicates an error in the API server

503.description: System dependency is down or undergoing maintenance. Try again later

navPercent.description: NAV % of the holding in the fund

fundName.example: REKSA DANA MANDIRI INVESTA PASAR UANG

navPercent.description: NAV % of the holding in the fund

businessPartnerId.description: Business Partner ID is the unique representation of client by country or entity in SCB core custody application. It will be provided to clients as part of the API onboarding.

securityAccountIds.description: Security Account Numbers are the Safe Keeping account numbers shared with clients during the onboarding or account opening.

security.description: Listed security of which this settlement is for

txId.description: Client Reference. Field length must be 16 characters.

tradDt.description: Trading Date of the instruction - format yyyy-MM-dd

sttlmDt.description: Settlement Date of the instruction - format yyyy-MM-dd

function.description: Nature of instruction - New instruction (NEWM) or Cancellation instruction (CANC)

units.description: Quantity expressed as units. Either units or faceAmt must be present in the request.

faceAmt.description: Quantity of security. Either units or faceAmt must be present in the request.

frBICFI.description: Client BIC Address. Either frBICFI or senderCtry must be present in the request. Length should be 8 (or) 11

toBICFI.description: SCB BIC Address. Length should be 8 (or) 11

senderCtry.description: This country code will be used to identify the Sending Entity. Either frBICFI or senderCtry must be present in the request. Length should be 2.

receiverCtry.description: This country code will be used to identify the Receiver Entity. Should be one among SG,ZA,HK,LK,VN,BD,TH,MY,CI,NG,MU,TZ,UG,ZM,BW,AE,QA,PK,OM,JO,BH,GH,KE,CN,ID,SL

othrTxId.description: Related Reference - In case of Cancellation (Previous Client reference to be quoted).Should be present if function is CANC. Length must be 16 characters.

iSIN.description: ISIN - Security Code. Either iSIN or finInstrmIdPrtry must be present in the request.

finInstrmIdPrtry.description: Cusip / Sedol / CDS numbers of the securities. Either iSIN or finInstrmIdPrtry must be present in the request.

pty1AnyBIC.description: Sub custodian BIC Address to whom the trade should be matched. Length should be 8 or 11 characters

pty1PrtryId.description: This field is used when 95R tag is used (DSS - Data source Scheme for European Markets)

ccy.description: Trade Currency. Length should be 3 characters

sttlmAmt.description: Actual number of Net Settlement Amount

plcOfTradCD.description: Stock Exchange and Place of Trade (mandatory only for SG Market)

plcOfTradDesc.description: Actual place of Trade and Financial Instrument - Present only once per Instruction record

pty1SfkpgAcct.description: Participant account of the counterparty in the depository

AltrnId.description: Counterparty BIC/Name and Client Type. Narrative :70C::PACO//CLNTTYPE/50/SLBCpty

pty3AnyBIC.description: BUYR/SELL information. Length should be 8 or 11

gncCshPricRcvdPctgPric.description: Deal price as rate/ percentage. Value must be numeric

dealPricAmt.description: Deal Amount. Value must be numeric

acrdIntrstCcy.description: Accrued Interest Currency. Length should be 3.

acrdIntrstAmt.description: Accrued Interest. Value must be numeric

regn.description: Registration Required. Can be either of two values NREG, YREG

tradTxCond.description: Coupon. Can be either of the two values CCPN, XCPN

pty2AnyBIC.description: DECU/RECU - (BIC / Country ). Length should be 8 or 11 characters

PlaceOfClearingIdentification2Id.description: Place of Clearing. Length should be 8 or 11 characters

sfkpgPlc.description: Place of Safe Keeping-Data Source Scheme(Narrative)

sfkpgPlcTpAndId.description: Place of Safe Keeping (Place Of Code-Narrative/Place Code-BIC Code)

newMtrtyDt.description: Maturity Date of the instruction - format yyyy-MM-dd

processingPosition3Code.description: Before/ After Indicator. Can be either of two values BEFO or AFTE

indctvPric.description: Indicative Price %. Value should be numeric

exrcPric.description: Exercise Price (Yield) %. Value should be numeric

sttlmSysMtd.description: Institutional Settlement System/Transfer. Should be either of two values NSET or YSET

tradDtTm.description: Trade date of the instruction - format HHmmss

cshPtiesDbtr.description: BENM - (BIC / Country). Length should be 8 or 11 characters

date.description:
Date of the newsflash  in yyyy-MM-dd[THH:MM] format, where [THH:MM] is
an optional time of day

headline.example: Partnership Between Bovespa and CME Group - Update

text.example:
In an update to our previous newsflash, Bovespa and CME Group (Chicago
Mercantile Exchange Group) have obtained the regulatory approval from
the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) to allow …

urgent.description:
Urgency of the newsflash. 0 – ordinary newsflash, for urgent ones will
have the value of 1

text.example: Partnership Between  Bovespa and CME Group - Update, 10/02/2009

id.description: Topic(channel) ID associated with the flash within the product

code.description: Unique code of the impacted market

text.example:
This information affects the data contained in the Other market where
securities are traded and Market Entry Requirements sections of the
Securities Market Information Service

base64EncodedData.description: Element contains base64-encoded files, attached to the flash
